summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to an unknown recipient (likely a colleague or supervisor) forwarding two attached emails from an unidentified individual who appears to be referencing the Epstein case but is not a victim or witness. The email serves as a notification about unsolicited civilian contacts regarding the case.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email who received two attached emails from an unidentified individual referencing the Epstein case and is forwarding them to notify a colleague.

keyFacts: An Assistant U.S. Attorney received unsolicited emails from an unidentified individual referencing the Epstein case.
The sender states the individual is not a victim or witness in the case.
The email was sent on August 12, 2019, during the period of Epstein's prosecution.
The correspondence indicates ongoing public interest and unsolicited contacts with prosecutors regarding the Epstein case.
The document is part of case 1:19-cr-00490-RMB, which is Jeffrey Epstein's criminal case.
